title: MicroservicesTransactionalMessagingPollingPublisher - Q0001
text: What is the primary purpose of the Polling Publisher pattern in microservices?

options.text: To reliably publish messages from a database to a message broker

explanation: The Polling Publisher pattern ensures reliable message publishing by polling a database for new events and sending them to a message broker.

title: MicroservicesTransactionalMessagingPollingPublisher - Q0002
text: Which of the following best describes the Polling Publisher pattern?

options.text: A background process polls a database table for new messages to publish
A service directly sends messages to a broker during a transaction
A synchronous API call publishes messages
A database trigger sends messages automatically

explanation: In the Polling Publisher pattern, a background process polls a database table for new messages and publishes them asynchronously.

title: MicroservicesTransactionalMessagingPollingPublisher - Q0003
text: Which problem does the Polling Publisher pattern primarily solve?

options.text: The dual-write problem between a database and a message broker

explanation: The Polling Publisher pattern solves the dual-write problem by decoupling message publishing from the main transaction.

title: MicroservicesTransactionalMessagingPollingPublisher - Q0004
text: What component is responsible for detecting new messages in the Polling Publisher pattern?
explanation: A background polling process periodically checks the database for new messages to publish.

title: MicroservicesTransactionalMessagingPollingPublisher - Q0005
text: Which of the following is a common data source for the Polling Publisher?
explanation: The Polling Publisher typically reads messages from an outbox table in the database.

title: MicroservicesTransactionalMessagingPollingPublisher - Q0006
text: Which of the following is a key advantage of the Polling Publisher pattern?

options.text: Ensures reliable message delivery without distributed transactions
Eliminates the need for message brokers

explanation: The Polling Publisher pattern ensures reliable message delivery without requiring distributed transactions.

title: MicroservicesTransactionalMessagingPollingPublisher - Q0007
text: Which of the following is a common challenge in implementing the Polling Publisher pattern?
explanation: Duplicate message delivery can occur if the polling process retries after a failure, requiring idempotent consumers.

title: MicroservicesTransactionalMessagingPollingPublisher - Q0008
text: Which of the following is a benefit of the Polling Publisher pattern for reliability?

options.text: Ensures messages are not lost even if the service crashes

explanation: Messages stored in the outbox table are persisted, ensuring they are not lost even if the service crashes.

title: MicroservicesTransactionalMessagingPollingPublisher - Q0009
text: Which of the following is a common strategy for marking messages as processed?

options.text: Updating a status column in the outbox table

explanation: Processed messages are typically marked by updating a status column in the outbox table.

explanation: The Polling Publisher pattern ensures consistency between database state and published messages.

title: MicroservicesTransactionalMessagingPollingPublisher - Q0011
text: Which of the following is a common polling interval strategy?
explanation: Polling intervals can be fixed or use exponential backoff to balance performance and load.

title: MicroservicesTransactionalMessagingPollingPublisher - Q0012

title: MicroservicesTransactionalMessagingPollingPublisher - Q0013
